body: I'm gonna take this if @syuhei176 don't feel blocked

### Task List

- [ ] core db adaptor (high priority)
- [ ] mem db impl (high priority)
- [ ] leveled impl(medium?)
- [ ] postgres impl(low?)

range db will be added in pigi. This db is abstraction for range to store current state and exitableRange.
https://github.com/plasma-group/pigi/pull/193/files#diff-d380414d866abe2ed2effb675d5df440
Noice catch! Will see that!
Pigi db abstractions are directly consuming leveldb though, I'm gonna insert one more layer to enable switching leveldb/postgressdb

`rayon.join` seems good for computation in parallel.
https://docs.rs/rayon/0.7.1/rayon/fn.join.html
Merkle Hash is CPU-bound task.

Parity is [using](https://github.com/paritytech/parity-ethereum/search?q=KeyValueDB&unscoped_q=KeyValueDB) `KeyValueDB` struct which is very standard in Rust.

This would be a good "CommonDB" interface of our usecase.
KeyValueDB was a dedicated interface for RocksDB
@tkmct failure can't be compiled for android because it depends on backtrace and backtrace depends on std. So I remove failure from plasma_core for now.
https://docs.rs/evm/0.11.0/evm/ is available for evm verifier.
move to https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/plasma-rust-framework/issues/34

lerna doesn't support this feature.
https://github.com/lerna/lerna/issues/2074#issuecomment-492442170

Idea:
`cargo monkey-patch plasma-db@^3 cryptoeconomicslab/plasma-db#master` replaces all the matching crates inside that monorepo, and build all.
We can do that later (Naive implementation first, then struggle with this matter)
https://doc.rust-lang.org/rustdoc/what-is-rustdoc.html

- Publish Wasm package to WAPM
- Use WAPM package and build example JS project with webpack using wasm-loader.
- How to use wasm file inside npm package???
I'll take this if it's okay.
@tkmct of course OK!

I added minimal ownership predicate.
https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/plasma-predicates/pull/13
It has an only executeStateTransition method for Predicate Plugin.

predicate plugin isn't run on EVM, client code should be supplied.
https://docs.plasma.group/projects/spec/en/latest/src/04-client-architecture/predicate-plugin.html#description
So now it's closer design with the early days Chamber.

Confirmed `cargo doc --no-deps --document-private-items --all` generates docs on local.

You can see it via `open ./target/doc/plasma_chamber/index.html`

![Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 14 13 47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4891004/58852799-e5e8bc80-86d2-11e9-9418-0c9291e2e3d8.png)

You can see workspace tips as well
![Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 14 49 52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4891004/58854330-ed5e9480-86d7-11e9-8161-666730668dca.png)

[GitHub Pages Deployment - TravisCI](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/deployment/pages/)
keep issues simple.
make another pr.
CI is already prepared
`cargo test` of core is reading comment as executables
What does this title's "patch" mean?

> What does this title's "patch" mean?

For this PR, I made a patched version of `ethabi`. Now write the dependency directory instead of `patch` syntax. But I guess it's not best.
https://github.com/cryptoeconomicslab/plasma-rust-framework/pull/54/files#diff-9d6a37721a19a3d5a17d6cf893fc8b19R8
